intro: Valeriana pumila, commonly known as lesser valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in terminal clusters during the summer months. Its roots are valued in traditional medicine for their sedative and calming properties. Valeriana pumila thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
